info.title: Yunbi
info.description: Professional Cloud Trading Platform for Digital Assets

parameters.name: access_key
parameters.description: Access key.

parameters.name: tonce
parameters.description: Tonce is an integer represents the milliseconds elapsed since Unix epoch.

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: The signature of your request payload, generated using your secret key.

get.summary: Where to deposit. The address field could be empty when a new address is generating (e.g. for bitcoin), you should try again later in that case.

parameters.name: access_key
parameters.description: Access key.

parameters.name: tonce
parameters.description: Tonce is an integer represents the milliseconds elapsed since Unix epoch.

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: The signature of your request payload, generated using your secret key.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The account to which you want to deposit. Available values: cny, btc, eth, pls, note, bts, bitcny, bitusd, bitbtc, yun, nxt, ltc, doge, sc, dgd, dcs, dao, etc, amp, 1st, rep, ans, zec, zmc, gnt, gxs, qtum, eos, snt, bcc, omg, lun, pay, ven

parameters.name: access_key
parameters.description: Access key.

parameters.name: tonce
parameters.description: Tonce is an integer represents the milliseconds elapsed since Unix epoch.

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: The signature of your request payload, generated using your secret key.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency value contains  cny, btc, eth, pls, note, bts, bitcny, bitusd, bitbtc, yun, nxt, ltc, doge, sc, dgd, dcs, dao, etc, amp, 1st, rep, ans, zec, zmc, gnt, gxs, qtum, eos, snt, bcc, omg, lun, pay, ven

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Set result limit.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: State value contains  submitting, cancelled, submitted, rejected, accepted, checked, warning

get.summary: Get depth or specified market. Both asks and bids are sorted from highest price to lowest.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btccny'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned price levels. Default to 300.

get.summary: Get OHLC(k line) of specific market.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btccny'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned data points, default to 30.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Time period of K line, default to 1. You can choose between 1, 5, 15, 30, 60, 120, 240, 360, 720, 1440, 4320, 10080

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch. If set, only k-line data after that time will be returned.

get.summary: Get K data with pending trades, which are the trades not included in K data yet, because there's delay between trade generated and processed by K data generator.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btccny'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

parameters.name: trade_id
parameters.description: The trade id of the first trade you received.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned data points, default to 30.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Time period of K line, default to 1. You can choose between 1, 5, 15, 30, 60, 120, 240, 360, 720, 1440, 4320, 10080

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch. If set, only k-line data after that time will be returned.

signature.description: The signature of your request payload, generated using your secret key.

get.summary: Get the order book of specified market.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btccny'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

parameters.name: asks_limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned sell orders. Default to 20.

parameters.name: bids_limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned buy orders. Default to 20.

get.summary: Get your orders, results is paginated.

parameters.name: access_key
parameters.description: Access key.

parameters.name: tonce
parameters.description: Tonce is an integer represents the milliseconds elapsed since Unix epoch.

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: The signature of your request payload, generated using your secret key.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btccny'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Filter order by state. One of 'wait', 'done', or 'cancel'. An order in 'wait' is an active order, waiting fullfillment; a 'done' order is an order fullfilled; 'cancel' means the order has been cancelled. Default to 'wait'.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned orders, default to 100.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specify the page of paginated results.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: If set, returned orders will be sorted in specific order. One of 'asc' or 'desc', default to 'asc'.

tonce.description: Tonce is an integer represents the milliseconds elapsed since Unix epoch.

signature.description: The signature of your request payload, generated using your secret key.

market.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btccny'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

volume.description: The amount user want to sell/buy. An order could be partially executed, e.g. an order sell 5 btc can be matched with a buy 3 btc order, left 2 btc to be sold; in this case the order's volume would be '5.0', its remaining_volume would be '2.0', its executed volume is '3.0'.

price.description: Price for each unit. e.g. If you want to sell/buy 1 btc at 3000 CNY, the price is '3000.0'

tonce.description: Tonce is an integer represents the milliseconds elapsed since Unix epoch.

signature.description: The signature of your request payload, generated using your secret key.

side.description: If present, only sell orders (asks) or buy orders (bids) will be canncelled.

tonce.description: Tonce is an integer represents the milliseconds elapsed since Unix epoch.

signature.description: The signature of your request payload, generated using your secret key.

market.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btccny'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

orders[volume].description: The amount user want to sell/buy. An order could be partially executed, e.g. an order sell 5 btc can be matched with a buy 3 btc order, left 2 btc to be sold; in this case the order's volume would be '5.0', its remaining_volume would be '2.0', its executed volume is '3.0'.

orders[price].description: Price for each unit. e.g. If you want to sell/buy 1 btc at 3000 CNY, the price is '3000.0'

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btccny'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

get.summary: Get server current time, in seconds since Unix epoch.
Get recent trades on market, each trade is included only once. Trades are sorted in reverse creation order.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btccny'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned trades. Default to 50.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch. If set, only trades executed before the time will be returned.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Trade id. If set, only trades created after the trade will be returned.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Trade id. If set, only trades created before the trade will be returned.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: If set, returned trades will be sorted in specific order. One of 'asc' or 'desc', default to 'desc'.

get.summary: Get your executed trades. Trades are sorted in reverse creation order.

parameters.name: access_key
parameters.description: Access key.

parameters.name: tonce
parameters.description: Tonce is an integer represents the milliseconds elapsed since Unix epoch.

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: The signature of your request payload, generated using your secret key.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy, where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quote currency code, e.g. 'btccny'. All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned trades. Default to 50.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch. If set, only trades executed before the time will be returned.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Trade id. If set, only trades created after the trade will be returned.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Trade id. If set, only trades created before the trade will be returned.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: If set, returned trades will be sorted in specific order. One of 'asc' or 'desc', default to 'desc'.
